Documentation.short_help: A customized Glyph filter for arrows only

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the filter. This is the dataset to which the glyphs will be applied.

StringVectorProperty.name: OrientationVectorArray
StringVectorProperty.label: Orientation
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This (mandatory) property indicates the name of the Velocity array.

IntVectorProperty.name: ScaleByOrientationVectorMagnitude
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Apply a scaling accroding to the vector magnitude

StringVectorProperty.name: ScaleArray
StringVectorProperty.label: Scaling Array
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The array to use for scaling glyphs

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ScaleFactor
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Apply a fixed scale to the glyphs

StringVectorProperty.name: ShaftRadiusArray
StringVectorProperty.label: Shaft Radius Scaling Array
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The array to use for scaling shaft radius

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ShaftRadiusFactor
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Apply a fixed scale to the shaft radius

StringVectorProperty.name: TipRadiusArray
StringVectorProperty.label: Tip Radius Scaling Array
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The array to use for scaling tip radius

DoubleVectorProperty.name: TipRadiusFactor
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Apply a fixed scale to the tip radius

IntVectorProperty.name: MaximumNumberOfPoints
IntVectorProperty.label: Maximum Number of Points
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property specifies the maximum number of glyphs that should appear in the output dataset if the value of the UseMaskPoints property is 1. (See the UseMaskPoints property.)

IntVectorProperty.name: UseMaskPoints
IntVectorProperty.label: Mask Points
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the value of this property is set to 1, limit the maximum number of glyphs to the value indicated by MaximumNumberOfPoints. (See the MaximumNumberOfPoints property.)

IntVectorProperty.name: RandomMode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the value of this property is 1, then the points to glyph are chosen randomly. Otherwise the point ids chosen are evenly spaced.
